definition: Earl George Macartney (1737-1806), leader of British mission to Qing China in 1793/Paul McCartney, former Beatle
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds)/Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha/(dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
the Macartney mission to Qing China in 1793
pinyin: Ma3 ga2 er3 ni2 shi3 tuan2
